alert.note: Alert for Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Hanford - Corcoran - Lemoore; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 07 at 4:16AM PST until March 07 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Low temperatures 29 to 34 degrees across most of the San Joaquin Valley tonight into Monday morning. * WHERE...Portions of the San Joaquin Valley. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will damage crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
